abstract: A credit ratings agency upgraded its outlook on 3i Group, saying the British private equity firm has ”significantly” reduced its net debt levels, The Associated Press reported.
snippet: A credit ratings agency upgraded its outlook on 3i Group, saying the British private equity firm has ”significantly” reduced its net debt levels, The Associated Press reported.
lead_paragraph: A credit ratings agency upgraded its outlook on 3i Group, saying the British private equity firm has ”significantly” reduced its net debt levels, The Associated Press reported.

abstract: The Fed chairman urged senators not to strip the Fed of its oversight authority, saying it was uniquely positioned to provide “strong, consolidated supervision.”
snippet: The Fed chairman urged senators not to strip the Fed of its oversight authority, saying it was uniquely positioned to provide “strong, consolidated supervision.”
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, urged Congress on Thursday not to strip the central bank of its power to regulate banks, warning that to do so would be a “grave mistake.”

headline.main: Bernanke Defends Fed’s Ability to Supervise Banks
headline.print_headline: Bernanke Cautions Senators Not to Curtail the Fed’s Banking Oversight

abstract: The Federal Reserve is examining the stratagems devised by Goldman Sachs and other big banks to help Greece mask its burgeoning debt over the last decade.
snippet: The Federal Reserve is examining the stratagems devised by Goldman Sachs and other big banks to help Greece mask its burgeoning debt over the last decade.
lead_paragraph: Greece’s problems deepened on both sides of the Atlantic as the Federal Reserve disclosed it was investigating Goldman Sachs and other banks that helped the country mask its debts, and investors grew increasingly leery of lending any more money to a nation flirting with default.

headline.main: In Greece’s Crisis, Fed Studies Wall St.’s Activities
headline.print_headline: As Greek Crisis Appears to Deepen, Fed Studies Wall St.’s Activities

byline.original: By Nelson D. Schwartz and Sewell Chan
